name: Square copy
description:
My first project ever! A copy of square.com. Made to test what I can achieve before taking on a framework. I focused on copying main layout and interactive elements with pop-up menus and such.

I'm especially proud of the double dropdown menu and grid layout mimicing the collage made with several photos in the original

name: Countdown
description:
Launch countdown timer - a Frontend Mentor challenge.

Used SCSS and BEM for the first time with this one, liked it, continued using it in all of my further projects. Taught me a lot about working with time and dates in JS.

name: Rock Paper Scissors
description:
Rock, Paper, Scissors game - another challenge by Frontend Mentor

This one really made me explore CSS, especially transform and transition properties.

name: Guild Wars 2 Item Search
description:
Item searching tool for Guild Wars 2. Basically an excuse to learn how to work with API and local storage.

Taught me a lot about asynchronous JS and writing sensible API requests

name: Redux 'blog'
description:
A simple fake blog-like feature, made just to learn Redux. Uses jsonplaceholder api.

This one taught me that the official documentation should be the first go-to place when learning a new technology.
